what: R Wrapper for Google’s Compact Language Detector 2
title: Google's Compact Language Detector 2
text: CLD2 probabilistically detects 80 languages Unicode UTF-8 text, either plain text HTML/XML. mixed-language input, CLD2 returns top three languages found approximate percentages total text bytes (e.g. 80% English 20% French 1000 bytes)

title: Google's Compact Language Detector 2
text: function detect_language() returns best guess NA language reliablity determined. Set plain_text = FALSE input contains HTML: Use detect_language_multi() get detailed classification output. shows top 3 language guesses proportion text classified language. bytes attribute shows total number text bytes classified, reliable complex calculation #1 language amount probable second-best Language.
code: cld2::detect_language("To be or not to be") # [1] "ENGLISH"  cld2::detect_language("Ce n'est pas grave.") # [1] "FRENCH"  cld2::detect_language("Nou breekt mijn klomp!") # [1] "DUTCH" cld2::detect_language(url('http://www.un.org/ar/universal-declaration-human-rights/'), plain_text = FALSE) # [1] "ARABIC"  cld2::detect_language(url('http://www.un.org/zh/universal-declaration-human-rights/'), plain_text = FALSE) # [1] "CHINESE" detect_language_multi(url('http://www.un.org/fr/universal-declaration-human-rights/'), plain_text = FALSE) # $classification #   language code latin proportion # 1   FRENCH   fr  TRUE       0.96 # 2  ENGLISH   en  TRUE       0.03 # 3   ARABIC   ar FALSE       0.00 #  # $bytes # [1] 17008 #  # $reliabale # [1] TRUE

title: Compact Language Detector 2 — cld2
text: function detect_language() vectorised guesses language string text returns NA language reliably determined. function detect_language_multi() vectorised analyses entire character vector whole. output includes top 3 detected languages including relative proportion total number text bytes reliably classified.
